data.product_name: Logitech G432 DTS:X 7.1 Surround Sound Wired PC Gaming Headset (Leatherette)

summary.topics: headset, headphone, logitech, microphone, mic, audio, ear, quality, headband, pair, cord, cable, hearing, mute, comfortable, sound, snug, removable, usb, surround, tangle, wire, listening, controller, comfort, noise, ordered, uncomfortable, noticeable, splitter, son, review, decent, upgrade, hear, glass, plastic, bass, plug, replacement, cushion, fine, swivel, acceptable, and xbox

price.review: Honestly, this was one of the best purchases I've made in terms of bang for buck. The price point is pretty impossible to beat for everything you get with the headset. The surround sound is a little trippy, but after using them for a little bit I can definitely see how beneficial the 7.1 surround sound can be. Listening to 8D audio is enhanced further with this headset. The best part about the headset is they work out of the box, but you can download drivers (software) to better suit the headset to what you are using them for (e.g. gaming, music, etc.). Overall, excellent investment.

Oh boi, this one is a waste of money. - put it on for 5 minutes and it started hurting my ears. - The sound is not surround 7.1 as G430 - There is no Bass and volume is way to low - Logitech software did not recognize this POS Don't even try listen to music or gaming with this. Return and Refund

Avoid this, i purchased it on black friday because it was like 40 bucks off. It feels like its very cheap when you put it on. The pads on the ear are not even comfortable, it feels like putting plastic on your ears. The sound quality...scratch that. There is no quality, a nokia cellphone will sound better than this by default. Get something else literally anything else. Get a rock and put it on your ears and you will have a better experience than using one of these.

They're not worth the $80 price tag. Get them while they're on sale. First Impressions: The build quality was rather sturdy. Very snug fit. Swivel earcups are a + (they might give some wearers the illusion of the headset feeling clunky when holding them. This is not the case. The sound quality is pretty lackluster as well as the microphone. Fortunately the audio quality can be improved [on PC] if you have a good 7.1 surround sound card installed to your motherboard. Use the audio splitter cable that comes with the headset and plug it directly into your soundcard. Boom, crisp clean input and output! After that these headphones are definitely a STEAL. Not too sure about the quality on console. Sorry guys.

Great product for the price. My son was ready to upgrade his headset for gaming/school/mixing music. Sound quality is very good, but Logitec has been consistent in making affordable, quality products for as long as i can remember. Son is very happy and I'm very impressed with the product. Can't go wrong!

quality.review: Jeeeezus.  This thing sounds so good that its making me lose my Modern Warfare matches.  Instead of actually using the headphones to my advantage I instead get distracted by all the little/minute intricate sounds on the game that this magnificent phones can pick up!!  Curses.

These sound great. I have been using Logitech H390 for over 10 years and the G432's are a huge upgrade over them. They sound great for gaming and music. Streaming movies also sounds so much better than my old headphones. The software is really basic and almost no customization or configuration options.
Overall good quality, and a great value for what it costs. Comparable to more expensive headsets at a fraction of the cost.
Great sound and comfort. A noticeable difference in gaming and good performance watching movies. I like the flip to mute on my mics.

Im amazed by the quality of this headset given its price. By far the best headset Ive bought for under 100 dollars. Although these do not have an active noise cancellation feature, the ear cups block out pretty much any background noise. The mic is clear, and the sound is crisp. The headset also comes with adapters so it can be used with a input/output combo port or split into separate jacks for input/output. Its also got a pretty long cable. I would recommend this for even seasoned gamers.

Absolutely made my online teaching easier.  My laptop is 7 years old and I have trouble hearing and speaking without shouting.  These are a godsend!  I also wear hearing aids.  I am waiting for my extension to arrive so I can use them with my TV.  Life is now beautiful since I stopped shouting and can hear my students.  They have made my life so much easier!!!

Nice set for the price. Feels great on your head, has good sound and mic is also nice. I like the feature that when you fold the mic it mutes. I dont use the supplied USB connection and directly connect it to my sound output. My box has the combo Mic + stereo 3.5mm jack however it comes with a supplied splitter if you have separate output + mic input jacks.

The sound from these is good.  There's an app from Logitech that installs if you use the USB Dongle where you can adjust the sound settings, EQ, Surround, Feedback, etc.  I used the EQ settings from a youtube video and I seem to like them pretty good.  My counterparts tell me the mic is clear.  The only issue I have is there is a little distortion from the mic feedback, the sound of my mic in my ear distorts but its not a showstopper. Overall I'm glad I bought these.

Decent audio, decent fit and so on. They're fine. The cord is fairly mediocre, and it's the weird little headphone wire some companies like to use that's a nightmare to splice once your cat gets frisky with it. (2 jacketed, 3 unjacketed, but coated.)
I still can't really tell whats up but it feels like the left is louder than the right but I'm still not sure at all. Overall not bad

I'm getting them tomorrow. But, I already have experience with this. I owned a few during the years and that is cause I refuse to use anything else. They are that good. They just get old like everything else and something breaks. But, over all if you are careful they will outlive any headset. Mine has. This ones I am buying are for my daughter and she is very clumsy.
They came out good, my son loved them.

Fianc has been using these for a month and a half now for gaming. He loves them. Theres no charging them and they easily mute by flipping the mic up. I personally found the earpads to be a little too stiff for my liking.

Much better than the previous headset I got for my son for school.  Right out of the box they worked so much better no fiddling with settings to get them just right.  His teacher can now hear him clearly. Also while gaming and on TS we can communicate.  Surround sound is much better and the price was right for the quality.

Below average in comfort mainly due to the narrow band of padding on the headband, creating an annoying discomfort on the top of my head no matter where I have it rest. Padding used is stiffer than I like as well, also creating pressure points on the sides of my head despite relaxing the headband spring. Outside of comfort, sound quality is good.
They do what I need very well!

I got this when the previous generation of this same headset that I had finally broke after about 5 years of fantastic use. This one is very similar, sound quality is just as good, volume is on the headset instead of inline, and the ear muffs are leather instead of cloth. Love it as much as my previous set.

headset.review: My previous headset was the Cloud Stinger from HyperX. Coming from that headset, the Logitech G432 is certainly much better in terms of sound quality. The bass is noticeably heavier, which can be further customized using Logitech's software. The software features multiple options, such as surround sound, noise cancellation, and different sound profiles. Build quality is also very solid, despite it being made out of plastic. Now onto the sole reason why I removed two stars. I would rate my head as being average in size. That being said, this is the most ungodly uncomfortable pair of headphones I have ever worn, period. It's presses around the ears very tightly, particularly towards the bottom of the ear cups. Compared to the Cloud Stinger, which I can wear as if it's not even on my head, I have to take this pair off every 10 minutes just from how absurdly uncomfortable it is. Of course, some people may not have this problem. It might fit perfectly fine for them. However, it's likely that I will be returning these from the sheer discomfort I have experienced. All the best sound quality in the world doesn't mean anything if you can barely keep it on your head.

Headset retains the build issues of the G430's low quality plastic body and boom attachment, but also has a significantly worse wire that is also so much shorter it can't reach from my PC that's 4 inches to my right over to my left side where it goes into the headset, worse adapter, and lower audio quality. The decision to change the mute to moving the boom also exacerbates the poor plastic quality and means it will break sooner than on the G430. I was expecting IMPROVEMENTS on an older model, not this. Avoid this model and just get the older one if you can find it.

Pros: -Good Mic Quality Cons: -Very uncomfortable to wear -Bad sound quality (At least for gaming) I bought a new headset because old one's mic stopped working. My old one has better sound quality and is way more comfortable, so i decided to use those for audio and put these next to me just for their mic. If you're looking for a comfortable good sound quality headset, dont buy these. if you just care about the microphone quality, then sure.
For gaming its good enough especially for the price. This headset sounds okay and Mic is good. But the noise is not cancellation too much. And cable is way too long for a controller in the lap.

I bought two headsets. This one and a cheaper one. The cheaper one ended up being better. My son doesn't like to use it as much as the other one.  He said it was uncomfortable, also sounds quality is not great. We don't see a mute button for mic and the volume is on back of headset so it makes it hard to turn it while gaming.

This headset was supposed to replace an extremely low quality headset and the quality of sound out of these was just a half a notch above poor. I bought this pair for the mic while gaming bc the Corwin headset I have sound great but have a poor mic. The search continues...

I had the G430 (I think)  and within less than a year it broke where the ear piece swivels below the headband. Decided to give Logitech another go and bought the G432 about two months ago.  The cord has already pulled away from the left ear muff. Still getting sound but the wires are exposed. I will be looking for a replacement in the near future.

It seems I'm not the only person to run into this issue. I bought my headset in October, and today, a few hours ago when I went to put my headset on...it cracked. I've never ever abused my headset. I only wear it when sitting, I put it on my desk when I'm done. It seems like this is a common issue, and I believe it has to do with the design of this area. The joint bits should NOT be plastic. It's going to flex tiny amounts each time you put it on, and it might not break all at once or be noticeable until it just does. Other than this design flaw, it's a good headset and of good sound quality for the price. It might not happen to every headset, but it seems like a clear design issue that will lead to this issue happening to at least some non-negligible portion of headsets, where a tiny defect or microcrack in the plastic can eventually lead to this. Going through customer support right now and I'll update once it gets here.

this headset is awesome i love it but for the money the cable could be a bit better make the cable removable and tangle/kink proof .every time i get ready to plug in the headset the cable always has a tangle or a couple twists in it  scared it might short 1 day and if it did having a removable cable would make it easy to replace other than that the 40 ish bucks i paid for it on black friday Was Well worth it you cant go wrong with this one

After a month and a half of normal usage one of the plastic parts keeping the headset together snapped. This seems to be an ongoing problem as it is fairly common when you search for the problem I have included an image of the break so that you can understand what is breaking and why it is a build quality problem. Overall the quality of sound was okay. The mic was also okay. But this build quality issue is not acceptable for the price of this headset.

The part where the ear cup is connected to the headband is poorly designed and made. Its peg is inserted into a slot in the ear cup, allowing it to rotate. It's plastic on plastic contact and poorly tolerance which means that the headset will creak constantly. Also, the 'DAC' that is included is a gimmick, and the default 'digital surround sound' setting makes any audio sound awful.

My old headset stopped working on me yesterday.  I needed a quality pair quickly.  So, I ordered the 4am-8am delivery of a pair the reviews said were so great.  I just received the Logitech G432.  Only one side worked.  I unplugged and plugged in again.  I made sure the plug was inserted correctly.  I'm returning them.  I've already ordered a different headset (rushed delivery) coming this evening.  I didn't want to take a chance on reordering the same pair.

headphone.review: My husband absolutely loves these headphones for gaming and this is actually his second pair! The others he accidentally stepped on them or he would still be using them

Sound-wise, I don't have any issues. Don't care much for the mic but don't really have issue with it either. I do find that these fit very tightly on my head though, which has given me some discomfort over time no matter how I adjust them. Usually I would leave my headphones on even when not listening to something, but with these I take them off whenever possible. Maybe I have a big head, I dunno.

the ad says it works with Xbox..well, barely.  I plug this headphone thru the 3.5mm jack on the Elite 2 controller. the volume is extremely low. it is so low I have a hard time hearing voices from my teammate in the game.  on a PC the volume is fine though the USB port so maybe it doesn't play well with the xbox controller.

This is the second pair of G432s I've owned in as many years and the second pair to break at the ear cup swivel. This time the ABS plastic holding in place broke in three places. I've bodged this pair twice now, and I won't be ordering a third. Do yourself a favor, buy Corsair or SteelSeries.

Like the title implies, I only wear glasses when looking at screens and when I'm gaming. These headphones feel cheap in build and quality, but the performance is better than you would expect. I got the leatherette ear cushions. These headphones fit very snug around the ears. Too much so that when I wear glasses, the headphones push the glasses frames into my head causing some pain and discomfort. The ear cushions themselves are also very stiff and crackly. I'd bet that there is just cheap foam underneath the cushions' surface. Returned.

For $50, I had expected something a bit better than this. The audio is tinny, and at max volume it's not very loud. They're not very comfortable either. Not bad, but not extremely comfortable either. The swivel mechanism on the earphones is annoying. There's no need for them to rotate 180 degrees, and I have to manually swivel them back each time I put them back on my head.

logitech.review: i bought these for my son since he got his new gaming laptop for his birthday.  I figured i start him out with this one instead of the 332 for the surround sound. It definitely exceeded my expectations,  but all my Logitech headphones do. If anything changes I will update but these are my 3rd pair of headphones gor different uses and they all still work including my first ones i bought over 9 years ago.

microphone.review: The sound going through the head phones gets picked up by the microphone just a little bit. Even when the sound is turned down very low. Update: The cross-talk issue happens when I use the headphone/microphone splitter. When I switched to USB it stopped.

mic.review: This worked okay for the last month but now the side w the microphone is loose. the ear piece disconnected and now it wont connect back together with the rest of the headset. very disappointed, completely ruined my mood and experience. great product guys! really nailed this one! you guys sure know how to make the worst headphones on this app! congrats! give yourselves a pat on the bat for creating something so disappointing! i tried calling and cant get a hold of anyone because of COVID-19 and its near impossible to find a support email to get help! wow! they care so much about customer support! HORRIBLE SERVICE

I bought 2 one for a friend who games daily, and one for myself. I like the Metal Head band (Not Plastic) But the best part IMO is the Mic. If you push it up it's OFF and Pull it down its ON. Brilliant Design from Logitech As with most things from Logitech... ;-) (I was not paid to give this endorsement, sadly) ;-(

I like the flip up to mute function on the mic. I use these on my PS4 and honestly theyre not that great. Surround sound is a bit choppy. I cant wear these for more than an hour before fatigue sets in. If youre eating anything forget about it because they move so much.

1) Ordered a pair, noticed than when I flip up the mic it does not mute like it should. 2) Ordered replacement, mic mutes but when checking microphone level it does not fully mute, I can still hear some input. 3) Noticed that both the original and replacement pair BOTH do not match the serial number on the headphones! This leads me to believe that they are either fake, used and packaged in the wrong box, or Logitech just straight up messed up when printing out serial numbers. Anyhow, this is not acceptable.
Says its for computer gaming but doesnt work for them I originally bought them for my son to play games On his computer when they didnt work I too it for my Xbox and works awesomely
Junk, the cord just winds round and round and can not be straightened out, I was going to send them back and got sick and was 1 day late on doing it!!! Never order this type again!!!

review_types.best_review: Honestly, this was one of the best purchases I've made in terms of bang for buck. The price point is pretty impossible to beat for everything you get with the headset. The surround sound is a little trippy, but after using them for a little bit I can definitely see how beneficial the 7.1 surround sound can be. Listening to 8D audio is enhanced further with this headset. The best part about the headset is they work out of the box, but you can download drivers (software) to better suit the headset to what you are using them for (e.g. gaming, music, etc.). Overall, excellent investment.
review_types.worst_review: 1) Ordered a pair, noticed than when I flip up the mic it does not mute like it should. 2) Ordered replacement, mic mutes but when checking microphone level it does not fully mute, I can still hear some input. 3) Noticed that both the original and replacement pair BOTH do not match the serial number on the headphones! This leads me to believe that they are either fake, used and packaged in the wrong box, or Logitech just straight up messed up when printing out serial numbers. Anyhow, this is not acceptable.
review_types.neutral: This is the second pair of G432s I've owned in as many years and the second pair to break at the ear cup swivel. This time the ABS plastic holding in place broke in three places. I've bodged this pair twice now, and I won't be ordering a third. Do yourself a favor, buy Corsair or SteelSeries.
